text: This Is Love is a studio/love album by Johnny Mathis. It was released on September 18, 1964 through Mercury Records and went to number 40 in the United States. It contains three cover singles by Nat King Cole. ==Track listing== ===Side one=== #"Put On a Happy Face" from Bye Bye Birdie (Charles Strouse, Lee Adams) – 3:15 #"Poinciana (Song of the Tree)" (Buddy Bernier, Nat Simon) – 4:07 #"The Touch of Your Lips" (Ray Noble) – 3:28 #"Just Move Along, Meadow Lark" (Eddie Snyder, Paul Vance) – 2:43 #"Under a Blanket of Blue" (Jerry Livingston, Al J. Neiburg, Marty Symes) – 3:45 #"Over the Weekend" (John Benson Brooks, Joseph McCarthy) – 3:52 ===Side two=== #"More" from Mondo Cane (Norman Newell, Nino Oliviero, Riz Ortolani) – 2:56 #"You Love Me" from Tovarich (Anne Crosswell, Lee Pockriss) – 3:47 #"Limehouse Blues" (Philip Braham, Douglas Furber) – 4:23 #"What Do You Feel in Your Heart" (Bart Howard) – 3:12 #"The End of a Love Affair" (Edward Redding) – 3:32 #"Fantastic" (Bart Howard) – 3:57 ==References== Category:1964 albums Category:Johnny Mathis albums Category:Mercury Records albums
title: This Is Love (Johnny Mathis album)
